snippet: Latonia Moore stepped in to sing the title role of “Aida” for an ailing Violeta Urmana at the Metropolitan Opera on Saturday afternoon, receiving an ecstatic ovation.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews Metropolitan Opera production of Verdi's Aida, featuring Latonia Moore, who replaced soprano Violeta Urmana in the title role after the scheduled singer became ill.
lead_paragraph: Latonia Moore stepped in to sing the title role of “Aida” for an ailing Violeta Urmana at the Metropolitan Opera on Saturday afternoon, receiving an ecstatic ovation.

headline.seo: Latonia Moore Steps In to ‘Aida’ at the Metropolitan Opera
headline.main: Bouquets and Bravas for the Met’s Sudden Aida
headline.print_headline: Bouquets And Bravas For the Met’s Sudden Aida
